topic.title: Authoring Tool Conformance
topic.shortdesc: Specifies conformance requirements for Lightweight DITA authoring tools.

body.p: The OASIS DITA Technical Committee designed Lightweight DITA to be accessible to the largest possible set of content contributors. Hence, the conformance requirements for Lightweight DITA authoring applications are intentionally minimally specified, particularly for the HDITA and MDITA authoring formats. Plain-text editors are considered viable tools for authoring HDITA and MDITA formats.

section.title: Conformance for XDITA authoring applications
section.p: An application that supports XDITA authoring must:

li.p: Constrain the set of available elements and attributes to those defined by this specification, with no or minimal configuration required.
Support authors in authoring valid XDITA maps, to define sets of Lightweight DITA (XDITA, HDITA, or MDITA) topics.

section.p: An application that supports XDITA authoring may:

li.p: Support authors, possibly in a graphical user interface, in setting the @props filtering attribute.
Support authors, possibly in a graphical user interface, in inserting valid content references.
Show or preview representations of XDITA topics with content references resolved and filtering applied.

section.title: Conformance for HDITA authoring applications
section.p: Text editors are considered viable authoring environments for HDITA.
Applications that support HDITA authoring may:

li.p: Provide guided authoring for HDITA topics, by presenting HDITA components in valid order and number.
Support authors in inserting valid HDITA components.
Limit authors to HDITA components of HTML5, or flag components that, while valid according to the HTML spec, are not legal in HDITA topics.
Support authors in authoring HDITA maps to define sets of HDITA topics.

section.title: Conformance for MDITA authoring applications
section.p: Applications that support MDITA authoring may:

li.p: Provide guided authoring for MDITA topics, by presenting MDITA components in valid order and number.
Support authors in inserting components from the MDITA extended profile, where necessary, to use Lightweight DITA features that are not available in the MDITA core profile.
Limit authors to components of GitHub Flavored Markdown that are legal in MDITA core profile topics, or flag components that are not legal in MDITA topics.
Support authors in authoring MDITA maps to define sets of MDITA topics.
